Malz can be stunned/killed while channeling his ultimate and his target can be pulled out of it or shielded/healed.

That definitely offers a bit more counterplay than being teleported in a 1v1 vs a stat-check Juggernaut.

Malz can also contribute to fight with his silence that has a 6s base CD at all ranks if the enemy carries are full QSS, Morde has only a short range 24-12s cd pull (and he doesn't get too much CDR to lower it).

I think Mordekaiser's new ultimate is an improvement and the death realm is really good thematically.  

Maybe the old ghost mechanic could come back on a new champion with an actual cohesive kit designed around summoned units.  Maybe Yorick could get better control over his Maiden of the Mist.  Maybe he could also bind the Maiden's fate to an ally, tethering the maiden to the ally, and if the ally takes lethal damage then the Maiden is consumed to grant a temporary revive, like his ultimate used to do (maybe slightly different in function to make it less glitch-prone).  During the temporary revive, it could make the ally appear gray-opaque as a ghost, so that would bring back champion ghosts to the game but in a somewhat different form than previously existed.  Obviously, Yorick would need to pay for this utility in his power budget somehow, so the Maiden could have its stats reduced and binding it to an ally could cause it to fade away automatically after a brief time limit.
Just make it a skillshot so morde can't just waltz up and pick a 1v1
